fields.value: CBS News/New York Times New York State Poll, April 1995

dsDescriptionValue.value: This poll queried respondents from the state of New York on  a range of political and social issues, with a focus on Governor  George Pataki. Respondents were asked to give their general opinions  of Pataki as well as Sheldon Silver, Al D'Amato, Daniel Moynihan, and  Rudolph Giuliani and to comment on taxes, welfare, funding and tuition  for the State Universities of New York (SUNYs), public schools, public  parks, and garbage pickup. Background information on respondents  includes voter registration status, political party, political orientation, education, age, sex, race, and family income.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

seriesName.value: CBS News/New York Times Poll Series

value: Adult population of New York State aged 18 and over having telephones at home.

fields.value: A variation of random-digit dialing using primary sampling  units (PSUs) was employed, consisting of blocks of 100 telephone  numbers identical through the eighth digit and stratified by  geographic region, area code, and size of place. Within households,  respondents were selected using a method developed by Leslie Kish and  modified by Charles Backstrom and Gerald Hursh (see Backstrom and  Hursh, SURVEY RESEARCH [Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press, 1963]).
